availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: N. B. Jones (Laurel hotel keeper and judge)

body.p: Laurel County, Kentucky, farmer, judge, and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Weaver Jones. Father of Talitha C. Jones, Ezekiel S. Jones, James T. Jones, and Lucinda C. Jones. Farmer in Laurel County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Judge of the Laurel County Court in 1860. Hotel keeper in Laurel County in 1863.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, p. 15; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, p. 26; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, London, p. 136; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, London, p. 146; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Laurel County, KY, June/July 1863, p. 87, (Accessed via ancestry.com); Find A Grave, "Napoleon Bonaparte Jones (1826-1876)," Memorial #24309419, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=24309419&ref=acom (accessed July 24, 2017).
